intro: Ilex mitis var. mitis, commonly known as the Mexican holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are opposite in arrangement. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Ilex mitis var. mitis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate urban environments.
